## GAD-7 vs BAQ

Research and clinical practice in psychology often involve the use of various assessment tools, among them are the Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and the Brief Aggression Questionnaire (BAQ). When it comes to comparing these instruments, such as GAD-7 vs BAQ, it can be challenging, particularly due to language variation and content harmonisation. However, thanks to Harmony â€“ a state-of-the-art software powered by AI, psychologists and researchers can conduct an efficient and accurate comparison between GAD-7 vs BAQ. Harmony leverages natural language processing and generative AI technology to harmonise questionnaire items such as GAD-7 and BAQ, streamlining the process for researchers. Rather than manually going through pages of questionnaires and transferring them into digital spreadsheets, Harmony automates the comparison process. For GAD-7 vs BAQ, the software will provide a percentage match between each questionnaire item allowing for a detailed examination of similarities and variations between the two tools. The use of Harmony offers significant advantages, particularly when comparing the instruments in different languages. Furthermore, it caters to the customization of the research process. Psychologists can either select GAD-7 vs BAQ from Harmony's database or upload their own tools via PDF on the web interface. This simplifies the harmonisation process, making cross-study comparisons and longitudinal analyses much more seamless and accurate.

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just BAQ into Harmony</a> - compare BAQ with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
